title: 3SUM
summary: In computational complexity theory, the 3SUM problem asks if a given set of n {\displaystyle n} real numbers contains three elements that sum to zero.  A generalized version, k-SUM, asks the same question on k numbers. 3SUM can be easily solved in O ( n 2 ) {\displaystyle O(n^{2})} time, and matching Ω ( n ⌈ k / 2 ⌉ ) {\displaystyle \Omega (n^{\lceil k/2\rceil })} lower bounds are known in some specialized models of computation (Erickson 1999).
